t: Psalm 132
The Eternal Dwelling of God in Zion
A Song of Ascents.
Lord,*spn remember David And*ild all his afflictions;
How*ld he swore to the Lord,*s And*ild vowed to the Mighty One of Jacob:
“Surely*ld I will not go into the chamber of my house, Or*ld go up to the comfort of my bed;
I*ld will not give sleep to my eyes Or*ild slumber to my eyelids,
Until*ld I find a place for the Lord,*s A*ld dwelling place for the Mighty One of Jacob.”
Behold,*ln we heard of it in Ephrathah; We*ld found it in the fields of the woods.
Let*ld us go into His tabernacle; Let*ld us worship at His footstool.
Arise,*ld O Lord,*s to Your resting place, You*ld and the ark of Your strength.
Let*ld Your priests be clothed with righteousness, And*ld let Your saints shout for joy.
For*ln Your servant David’s sake, Do*ld not turn away the face of Your Anointed.
The*ln Lord*s has sworn in*i truth to David; He*ld will not turn from it: “I*ld will set upon your throne the fruit of your body.
If*ld your sons will keep My covenant And*ld My testimony which I shall teach them, Their*ld sons also shall sit upon your throne forevermore.”
For*ln the Lord*s has chosen Zion; He*ld has desired it*i for His dwelling place:
“This*ld is*i My resting place forever; Here*ld I will dwell, for I have desired it.
I*ld will abundantly bless her provision; I*ld will satisfy her poor with bread.
I*ld will also clothe her priests with salvation, And*ld her saints shall shout aloud for joy.
There*ld I will make the horn of David grow; I*ld will prepare a lamp for My Anointed.
His*ld enemies I will clothe with shame, But*ld upon Himself His crown shall flourish.”
